subheadings.name: Creation
subheadings.description:
Tensors are the core datastructure of deeplearn.js. They are a generalization of vectors and matrices to potentially higher dimensions.

We have utility functions for common cases like Scalar, 1D, 2D, 3D and 4D tensors, as well a number of functions to initialize tensors in ways useful for machine learning.

parameters.name: values
parameters.documentation:
The values of the tensor. Can be nested array of numbers,
or a flat array, or a [TypedArray](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/TypedArray).

parameters.name: shape
parameters.documentation:
The shape of the tensor. Optional. If not provided,
it is inferred from `values`.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: The data type.

parameters.name: value
parameters.documentation: The value of the scalar.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: The data type.

symbols.documentation:
Creates rank-0 [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) (scalar) with the provided value and dtype.

This method is mainly for self documentation and TypeScript typings as the
same functionality can be achieved with [dl.tensor()](#dl.tensor). In general, we recommend
using this method as it makes code more readable.

```js
dl.scalar(3.14).print();
```

parameters.name: values
parameters.documentation:
The values of the tensor. Can be array of numbers,
or a [TypedArray](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/TypedArray).

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: The data type.

symbols.documentation:
Creates rank-1 [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) with the provided values, shape and dtype.

This method is mainly for self documentation and TypeScript typings as the
same functionality can be achieved with [dl.tensor()](#dl.tensor). In general, we recommend
using this method as it makes code more readable.

```js
dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 3]).print();
```

parameters.name: values
parameters.documentation:
The values of the tensor. Can be nested array of numbers,
or a flat array, or a [TypedArray](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/TypedArray).

parameters.name: shape
parameters.documentation:
The shape of the tensor. If not provided, it is inferred from
`values`.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: The data type.

parameters.name: values
parameters.documentation:
The values of the tensor. Can be nested array of numbers,
or a flat array, or a [TypedArray](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/TypedArray).

parameters.name: shape
parameters.documentation:
The shape of the tensor. If not provided,  it is inferred from
`values`.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: The data type.

parameters.name: values
parameters.documentation:
The values of the tensor. Can be nested array of numbers,
or a flat array, or a [TypedArray](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/TypedArray).

parameters.name: shape
parameters.documentation:
The shape of the tensor. Optional. If not provided,
it is inferred from `values`.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: The data type.

parameters.name: shape
parameters.documentation: An array of integers defining the output tensor shape.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: The dtype of the buffer. Defaults to 'float32'.

parameters.name: values
parameters.documentation: The values of the buffer as [TypedArray](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/TypedArray). Defaults to zeros.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The tensor to clone.

parameters.name: shape
parameters.documentation: An array of integers defining the output tensor shape.

parameters.name: value
parameters.documentation: The scalar value to fill the tensor with.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation:
The type of an element in the resulting tensor. Defaults to
'float'.

symbols.documentation:
Creates a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) filled with a scalar value.

```js
dl.fill([2, 2], 4).print();
```

parameters.name: pixels
parameters.documentation: The input image to construct the tensor from.

parameters.name: numChannels
parameters.documentation:
The number of channels of the output tensor. The
supported image types are all 4-channel by default, a numChannels value
less than 4 allows you to ignore channels.

parameters.name: start
parameters.documentation: The start value of the sequence.

parameters.name: stop
parameters.documentation: The end value of the sequence.

parameters.name: num
parameters.documentation: The number of values to generate.

symbols.documentation:
Return an evenly spaced sequence of numbers over the given interval.

```js
dl.linspace(0, 9, 10).print();
```

parameters.name: indices
parameters.documentation: 1D Array of indices.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.documentation: The depth of the one hot dimension.

parameters.name: onValue
parameters.documentation:
A number used to fill in output when the index matches
the location.

parameters.name: offValue
parameters.documentation:
A number used to fill in the output when the index does
not match the location.

symbols.documentation:
Creates a one-hot [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor). The locations represented by `indices` take
value `onValue` (defaults to 1), while all other locations take value
`offValue` (defaults to 0).

```js
dl.oneHot(dl.tensor1d([0, 1]), 3).print();
```

parameters.name: shape
parameters.documentation: An array of integers defining the output tensor shape.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation:
The type of an element in the resulting tensor. Defaults to
'float'.

symbols.documentation:
Creates a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) with all elements set to 1.

```js
dl.ones([2, 2]).print();
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: A tensor.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The tensor to be printed.

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.documentation:
Whether to print verbose information about the ` Tensor`,
including dtype and size.

parameters.name: shape
parameters.documentation: An array of integers defining the output tensor shape.

parameters.name: mean
parameters.documentation: The mean of the normal distribution.

parameters.name: stdDev
parameters.documentation: The standard deviation of the normal distribution.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: The data type of the output.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.documentation: The seed for the random number generator.

symbols.documentation:
Creates a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) with values sampled from a normal distribution.

```js
dl.randomNormal([2, 2]).print();
```

parameters.name: shape
parameters.documentation: An array of integers defining the output tensor shape.

parameters.name: minval
parameters.documentation:
The lower bound on the range of random values to generate.
Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: maxval
parameters.documentation:
The upper bound on the range of random values to generate.
Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: The data type of the output tensor. Defaults to 'float32'.

symbols.documentation:
Creates a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) with values sampled from a uniform distribution.

The generated values follow a uniform distribution in the range [minval,
maxval). The lower bound minval is included in the range, while the upper
bound maxval is excluded.

```js
dl.randomUniform([2, 2]).print();
```

parameters.name: start
parameters.documentation: An integer start value

parameters.name: stop
parameters.documentation: An integer stop value

parameters.name: step
parameters.documentation: An integer increment (will default to 1 or -1)

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: The data type of the output tensor. Defaults to 'float32'.

symbols.documentation:
Creates a new [Tensor1D](#class:dl.Tensor) filled with the numbers in the range provided.

The tensor is a is half-open interval meaning it includes start, but
excludes stop. Decrementing ranges and negative step values are also
supported.

```js
dl.range(0, 9, 2).print();
```

parameters.name: shape
parameters.documentation: An array of integers defining the output tensor shape.

parameters.name: mean
parameters.documentation: The mean of the normal distribution.

parameters.name: stdDev
parameters.documentation: The standard deviation of the normal distribution.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: The data type of the output tensor.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.documentation: The seed for the random number generator.

symbols.documentation:
Creates a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) with values sampled from a truncated normal
distribution.

```js
dl.truncatedNormal([2, 2]).print();
```

The generated values follow a normal distribution with specified mean and
standard deviation, except that values whose magnitude is more than 2
standard deviations from the mean are dropped and re-picked.

parameters.name: initialValue
parameters.documentation: Initial value for the tensor.

parameters.name: trainable
parameters.documentation: If true, optimizers are allowed to update it.

parameters.name: name
parameters.documentation: Name of the variable. Defaults to a unique id.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: If set, initialValue will be converted to the given type.

parameters.name: shape
parameters.documentation: An array of integers defining the output tensor shape.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation:
The type of an element in the resulting tensor. Can
be 'float32', 'int32' or 'bool'. Defaults to 'float'.

symbols.documentation:
Creates a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) with all elements set to 0.

```js
dl.zeros([2, 2]).print();
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The tensor of required shape.

subheadings.name: Classes
subheadings.description: This section shows the main Tensor related classes in deeplearn.js and the methods we expose on them.

symbols.documentation:
A [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) object represents an immutable, multidimensional array of numbers
that has a shape and a data type.

See [dl.tensor()](#dl.tensor) for details on how to create a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor).

methods.documentation: Flatten a Tensor to a 1D array.
Converts a size-1 [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to a [Scalar](#class:dl.Tensor).
Converts a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to a [Tensor1D](#class:dl.Tensor).

parameters.name: rows
parameters.documentation: Number of rows in [Tensor2D](#class:dl.Tensor).

parameters.name: columns
parameters.documentation: Number of columns in [Tensor2D](#class:dl.Tensor).

methods.documentation: Converts a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to a [Tensor2D](#class:dl.Tensor).

parameters.name: rows
parameters.documentation: Number of rows in [Tensor3D](#class:dl.Tensor).

parameters.name: columns
parameters.documentation: Number of columns in [Tensor3D](#class:dl.Tensor).

parameters.name: depth
parameters.documentation: Depth of [Tensor3D](#class:dl.Tensor).

methods.documentation: Converts a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to a [Tensor3D](#class:dl.Tensor).

parameters.name: rows
parameters.documentation: Number of rows in [Tensor4D](#class:dl.Tensor).

parameters.name: columns
parameters.documentation: Number of columns in [Tensor4D](#class:dl.Tensor).

parameters.name: depth
parameters.documentation: Depth of [Tensor4D](#class:dl.Tensor).

parameters.name: depth2
parameters.documentation: 4th dimension of [Tensor4D](#class:dl.Tensor).

methods.documentation: Converts a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to a [Tensor4D](#class:dl.Tensor).

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: Data-type to cast the tensor to.

methods.documentation: Casts a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to a specified dtype.
Returns a [TensorBuffer](#class:dl.TensorBuffer) that holds the underlying data.

Asynchronously downloads the values from the [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor). Returns a promise of
[TypedArray](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/TypedArray) that resolves when the computation has finished.

Synchronously downloads the values from the [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor). This blocks the UI
thread until the values are ready, which can cause performance issues.
Disposes [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) from memory.
Casts the array to type `float32`
Casts the array to type `int32`
Casts the array to type `bool`

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.documentation:
Whether to print verbose information about the tensor,
including dtype and size.

methods.documentation: Prints the [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor). See [dl.print()](#dl.print) for details.

parameters.name: newShape
parameters.documentation: An array of integers defining the output tensor shape.

methods.documentation:
Reshapes the tensor into the provided shape.
See [dl.reshape()](#dl.reshape) for more details.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The tensor of required shape.

methods.documentation: Reshapes the tensor into the shape of the provided tensor.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
The dimension index at which to insert shape of 1. Defaults to
0 (the first dimension).

methods.documentation:
Returns a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) that has expanded rank, by inserting a dimension
into the tensor's shape. See [dl.expandDims()](#dl.expandDims) for details.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
A list of numbers. If specified, only squeezes the
dimensions listed. The dimension index starts at 0. It is an error to
squeeze a dimension that is not 1.

methods.documentation:
Returns a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) with dimensions of size 1 removed from the shape.
See [dl.squeeze()](#dl.squeeze) for more details.
Returns a copy of the tensor. See [dl.clone()](#dl.clone) for details.
Returns a human-readable description of the tensor. Useful for logging.

symbols.documentation: A mutable [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor), useful for persisting state, e.g. for training.

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.documentation: New tensor to be assigned to this variable.

methods.documentation:
Assign a new [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to this variable. The new [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) must have the
same shape and dtype as the old [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor).

symbols.documentation:
A mutable object, similar to [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor), that allows users to set values
at locations before converting to an immutable [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor).

See [dl.buffer()](#dl.buffer) for creating a tensor buffer.

parameters.name: value
parameters.documentation: The value to set.

parameters.name: locs
parameters.documentation: The location indices.

methods.documentation: Sets a value in the buffer at a given location.

parameters.name: locs
parameters.documentation: The location indices.

methods.documentation: Returns the value in the buffer at the provided location.
Creates an immutable [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) object from the buffer.

subheadings.name: Transformations
subheadings.description: This section describes some common Tensor transformations for reshaping and type-casting.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor to be casted.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation: The dtype to cast the input tensor to.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor whose dimensions to be expanded.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
The dimension index at which to insert shape of `1`. Defaults
to 0 (the first dimension).

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The tensor to pad.

parameters.name: paddings
parameters.documentation:
An array of length `R` (the rank of the tensor), where each
element is a length-2 tuple of ints `[padBefore, padAfter]`, specifying
how much to pad along each dimension of the tensor.

parameters.name: constantValue
parameters.documentation: The pad value to use. Defaults to 0.

symbols.documentation:
Pads a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) with a given value and paddings.

This operation currently only implements the `CONSTANT` mode from
Tensorflow's [dl.pad()](#dl.pad) operation.

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 3, 4]);
x.pad([[1, 2]]).print();
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor to be reshaped.

parameters.name: shape
parameters.documentation: An array of integers defining the output tensor shape.

symbols.documentation:
Reshapes a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to a given shape.

Given a input tensor, returns a new tensor with the same values as the
input tensor with shape `shape`.

If one component of shape is the special value -1, the size of that
dimension is computed so that the total size remains constant. In
particular, a shape of [-1] flattens into 1-D. At most one component of
shape can be -1.

If shape is 1-D or higher, then the operation returns a tensor with shape
shape filled with the values of tensor. In this case, the number of
elements implied by shape must be the same as the number of elements in
tensor.

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 3, 4]);
x.reshape([2, 2]).print();
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor to be squeezed.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
An optional list of numbers. If specified, only
squeezes the dimensions listed. The dimension index starts at 0. It is
an error to squeeze a dimension that is not 1.

subheadings.name: Slicing and Joining
subheadings.description: deeplearn.js provides several operations to slice or extract parts of a tensor, or join multiple tensors together.

parameters.name: tensors
parameters.documentation: A list of tensors to concatenate.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation: The axis to concate along. Defaults to 0 (the first dim).

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor whose slices to be gathered.

parameters.name: indices
parameters.documentation: The indices of the values to extract.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation: The axis over which to select values. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor to be reversed.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
The set of dimensions to reverse. Must be in the
range [-rank(x), rank(x)). Defaults to all axes.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to slice from.

parameters.name: begin
parameters.documentation:
The coordinates to start the slice from. The length of this
array should match the rank of `x`.

parameters.name: size
parameters.documentation:
The size of the slice. The length of this array should match
the rank of `x`.

symbols.documentation:
Extracts a slice from a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) starting at coordinates `begin`
and is of size `size`.

Also available are stricter rank-specific methods with the same signature
as this method that assert that `x` is of the given rank:
   - `dl.slice1d`
   - `dl.slice2d`
   - `dl.slice3d`
   - `dl.slice4d`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 3, 4]);

x.slice([1], [2]).print();
```

```js
const x = dl.tensor2d([1, 2, 3, 4], [2, 2]);

x.slice([1, 0], [1, 2]).print();
```

parameters.name: tensors
parameters.documentation: A list of tensor objects with the same shape and dtype.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation: The axis to stack along. Defaults to 0 (the first dim).

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The tensor to transpose.

parameters.name: reps
parameters.documentation: Determines the number of replications per dimension.

symbols.documentation:
Construct an tensor by repeating it the number of times given by reps.

This operation creates a new tensor by replicating `input` `reps`
times. The output tensor's i'th dimension has `input.shape[i] *
reps[i]` elements, and the values of `input` are replicated
`reps[i]` times along the i'th dimension. For example, tiling
`[a, b, c, d]` by `[2]` produces `[a, b, c, d, a, b, c, d]`.

```js
const a = dl.tensor1d([1, 2]);

a.tile([2]).print();    // or a.tile([2])
```

```js
const a = dl.tensor2d([1, 2, 3, 4], [2, 2]);

a.tile([1, 2]).print();  // or a.tile([1, 2])
```

subheadings.name: Arithmetic
subheadings.description: To perform mathematical computation on Tensors, we use operations. Tensors are immutable, so all operations always return new Tensors and never modify input Tensors.

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to add.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: The second [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to add. Must have the same type as `a`.

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to subtract from.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation:
The second [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to be subtracted. Must have the same dtype as
`a`.

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first tensor to multiply.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: The second tensor to multiply. Must have the same dtype as `a`.

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first tensor as the numerator.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation:
The second tensor as the denominator. Must have the same dtype as
`a`.

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first tensor.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: The second tensor. Must have the same type as `a`.

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first tensor.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: The second tensor. Must have the same type as `a`.

parameters.name: base
parameters.documentation: The base [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to pow element-wise.

parameters.name: exp
parameters.documentation: The exponent [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to pow element-wise.

symbols.documentation:
Computes the power of one [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) to another. Supports broadcasting.

Given a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) x and a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) y, this operation computes x^y for
corresponding elements in x and y.

```js
const a = dl.tensor([[2, 3], [4, 5]])
const b = dl.tensor([[1, 2], [3, 0]]).toInt();

a.pow(b).print();  // or dl.pow(a, b)
```

```js
const a = dl.tensor([[1, 2], [3, 4]])
const b = dl.tensor(2).toInt();

a.pow(b).print();  // or dl.pow(a, b)
```
We also expose `powStrict` which has the same signature as this op and
asserts that `base` and [dl.exp()](#dl.exp) are the same shape (does not broadcast).

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor).

symbols.documentation:
Computes absolute value element-wise: `abs(x)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([-1, 2, -3, 4]);

x.abs().print();  // or dl.abs(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes acos of the input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise: `acos(x)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([0, 1, -1, .7]);

x.acos().print();  // or dl.acos(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes asin of the input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise: `asin(x)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([0, 1, -1, .7]);

x.asin().print();  // or dl.asin(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes atan of the input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise: `atan(x)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([0, 1, -1, .7]);

x.atan().print();  // or dl.atan(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input Tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes ceiling of input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise: `ceil(x)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([.6, 1.1, -3.3]);

x.ceil().print();  // or dl.ceil(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

parameters.name: clipValueMin
parameters.documentation: Lower-bound of range to be clipped to.

parameters.name: clipValueMax
parameters.documentation: Upper-bound of range to be clipped to.

symbols.documentation:
Clips values element-wise. `max(min(x, clipValueMax), clipValueMin)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([-1, 2, -3, 4]);

x.clipByValue(-2, 3).print();  // or dl.clipByValue(x, -2, 3)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes cos of the input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise: `cos(x)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([0, Math.PI / 2, Math.PI * 3 / 4]);

x.cos().print();  // or dl.cos(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes hyperbolic cos of the input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise: `cosh(x)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([0, 1, -1, .7]);

x.cosh().print();  // or dl.cosh(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes exponential linear element-wise, `x > 0 ? e ^ x - 1 : 0`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([-1, 1, -3, 2]);

x.elu().print();  // or dl.elu(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes exponential of the input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise. `e ^ x`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, -3]);

x.exp().print();  // or dl.exp(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes floor of input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise: `floor(x)`.

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([.6, 1.1, -3.3]);

x.floor().print();  // or dl.floor(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.documentation: The scaling factor for negative values, defaults to 0.2.

symbols.documentation:
Computes leaky rectified linear element-wise.

See
[http://web.stanford.edu/~awni/papers/relu_hybrid_icml2013_final.pdf](
     http://web.stanford.edu/~awni/papers/relu_hybrid_icml2013_final.pdf)

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([-1, 2, -3, 4]);

x.leakyRelu(0.1).print();  // or dl.leakyRelu(x, 0.1)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes natural logarithm of the input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise: `ln(x)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, Math.E]);

x.log().print();  // or dl.log(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes `-1 * x` element-wise.

```js
const x = dl.tensor2d([1, 2, -2, 0], [2, 2]);

x.neg().print();  // or dl.neg(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.documentation: Scaling factor for negative values.

symbols.documentation:
Computes leaky rectified linear element-wise with parametric alphas.

`x < 0 ? alpha * x : f(x) = x`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([-1, 2, -3, 4]);
const alpha = dl.scalar(0.1);

x.prelu(alpha).print();  // or dl.prelu(x, alpha)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes rectified linear element-wise: `max(x, 0)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([-1, 2, -3, 4]);

x.relu().print();  // or dl.relu(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes scaled exponential linear element-wise.

`x < 0 ? scale * alpha * (exp(x) - 1) : x`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([-1, 2, -3, 4]);

x.selu().print();  // or dl.selu(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes sigmoid element-wise, `1 / (1 + exp(-x))`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([0, -1, 2, -3]);

x.sigmoid().print();  // or dl.sigmoid(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes sin of the input Tensor element-wise: `sin(x)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([0, Math.PI / 2, Math.PI * 3 / 4]);

x.sin().print();  // or dl.sin(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes hyperbolic sin of the input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise: `sinh(x)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([0, 1, -1, .7]);

x.sinh().print();  // or dl.sinh(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes square root of the input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise: `y = sqrt(x)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 4, -1]);

x.sqrt().print();  // or dl.sqrt(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input Tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes square of `x` element-wise: `x ^ 2`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, Math.sqrt(2), -1]);

x.square().print();  // or dl.square(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.documentation: The gradient when input is negative.

symbols.documentation:
Computes step of the input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise: `x > 0 ? 1 : alpha * x`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([0, 2, -1, -3]);

x.step(.5).print();  // or dl.step(x, .5)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes tan of the input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise, `tan(x)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([0, Math.PI / 2, Math.PI * 3 / 4]);

x.tan().print();  // or dl.tan(x)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Computes hyperbolic tangent of the input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) element-wise: `tanh(x)`

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([0, 1, -1, 70]);

x.tanh().print();  // or dl.tanh(x)
```

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: First matrix in dot product operation.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: Second matrix in dot product operation.

parameters.name: transposeA
parameters.documentation: If true, `a` is transposed before multiplication.

parameters.name: transposeB
parameters.documentation: If true, `b` is transposed before multiplication.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input array.

parameters.name: ord
parameters.documentation:
Optional. Order of the norm. Supported norm types are
following:

| ord        | norm for matrices         | norm for vectors
|------------|---------------------------|---------------------
|'euclidean' |Frobenius norm             |2-norm
|'fro'       |Frobenius norm	           |
|Infinity    |max(sum(abs(x), axis=1))   |max(abs(x))
|-Infinity   |min(sum(abs(x), axis=1))   |min(abs(x))
|1           |max(sum(abs(x), axis=0))   |sum(abs(x))
|2           |                           |sum(abs(x)^2)^1/2*

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
Optional. If axis is null (the default), the input is
considered a vector and a single vector norm is computed over the entire
set of values in the Tensor, i.e. norm(x, ord) is equivalent
to norm(x.reshape([-1]), ord). If axis is a integer, the input
is considered a batch of vectors, and axis determines the axis in x
over which to compute vector norms. If axis is a 2-tuple of integer it is
considered a batch of matrices and axis determines the axes in NDArray
over which to compute a matrix norm.

parameters.name: keepDims
parameters.documentation:
Optional. If true, the norm have the same dimensionality
as the input.

symbols.documentation:
Computes the norm of scalar, vectors, and matrices.
This function can compute several different vector norms (the 1-norm, the
Euclidean or 2-norm, the inf-norm, and in general the p-norm for p > 0)
and matrix norms (Frobenius, 1-norm, and inf-norm).

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 3, 4]);

x.norm().print();  // or dl.norm(x)
```

parameters.name: v1
parameters.documentation: The first vector in the outer product operation.

parameters.name: v2
parameters.documentation: The second vector in the dot product operation.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The tensor to transpose.

parameters.name: perm
parameters.documentation: The permutation of the dimensions of a.

symbols.documentation:
Transposes the [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor). Permutes the dimensions according to `perm`.

The returned [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor)'s dimension `i` will correspond to the input
dimension `perm[i]`. If `perm` is not given, it is set to `[n-1...0]`,
where `n` is the rank of the input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor). Hence by default, this
operation performs a regular matrix transpose on 2-D input [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor)s.

```js
const a = dl.tensor2d([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6], [2, 3]);

a.transpose().print();  // or dl.transpose(a)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation:
The input tensor, of rank 4 or rank 3 of shape
`[batch, height, width, inChannels]`. If rank 3, batch of 1 is assumed.

parameters.name: filterSize
parameters.documentation: The filter size, a tuple `[filterHeight, filterWidth]`.

parameters.name: strides
parameters.documentation: The strides of the pooling: `[strideHeight, strideWidth]`.

parameters.name: pad
parameters.documentation:
The type of padding algorithm:
- `same` and stride 1: output will be of same size as input,
regardless of filter size.
- `valid`: output will be smaller than input if filter is larger
than 1x1.
- For more info, see this guide:
[https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Convolution](
https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Convolution)

parameters.name: dimRoundingMode
parameters.documentation:
The rounding mode used when computing output
dimensions if pad is a number. If none is provided, it will not round
and error if the output is of fractional size.

symbols.documentation: Computes the 2D average pooling of an image.

parameters.name: input
parameters.documentation:
The input tensor, of rank 3 or rank 2, of shape
`[batch, width, inChannels]`. If rank 2, batch of 1 is assumed.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.documentation:
The filter, rank 3, of shape
`[filterWidth, inDepth, outDepth]`.

parameters.name: stride
parameters.documentation:
The number of entries by which the filter is moved right at
each step.

parameters.name: pad
parameters.documentation:
The type of padding algorithm.
- `same` and stride 1: output will be of same size as input,
regardless of filter size.
- `valid`: output will be smaller than input if filter is larger
than 1x1.
- For more info, see this guide:
[https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Convolution](
https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Convolution)

parameters.name: dimRoundingMode
parameters.documentation:
The rounding mode used when computing output
dimensions if pad is a number. If none is provided, it will not round
and error if the output is of fractional size.

symbols.documentation: Computes a 1D convolution over the input x.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation:
The input tensor, of rank 4 or rank 3, of shape
`[batch, height, width, inChannels]`. If rank 3, batch of 1 is
assumed.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.documentation:
The filter, rank 4, of shape
`[filterHeight, filterWidth, inDepth, outDepth]`.

parameters.name: strides
parameters.documentation:
The strides of the convolution: `[strideHeight,
strideWidth]`.

parameters.name: pad
parameters.documentation:
The type of padding algorithm.
- `same` and stride 1: output will be of same size as input,
regardless of filter size.
- `valid`: output will be smaller than input if filter is larger
than 1x1.
- For more info, see this guide:
[https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Convolution](
https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Convolution)

parameters.name: dimRoundingMode
parameters.documentation:
The rounding mode used when computing output
dimensions if pad is a number. If none is provided, it will not round
and error if the output is of fractional size.

symbols.documentation: Computes a 2D convolution over the input x.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation:
The input image, of rank 4 or rank 3, of shape
`[batch, height, width, inDepth]`. If rank 3, batch of 1 is assumed.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.documentation:
The filter, rank 4, of shape
`[filterHeight, filterWidth, outDepth, inDepth]`.
`inDepth` must match `inDepth` in `x`.

parameters.name: outputShape
parameters.documentation:
Output shape, of rank 4 or rank 3:
`[batch, height, width, outDepth]`. If rank 3, batch of 1 is assumed.

parameters.name: strides
parameters.documentation:
The strides of the original convolution:
`[strideHeight, strideWidth]`.

parameters.name: pad
parameters.documentation:
The type of padding algorithm used in the non-transpose version
of the op.

parameters.name: dimRoundingMode
parameters.documentation:
The rounding mode used when computing output
dimensions if pad is a number. If none is provided, it will not round
and error if the output is of fractional size.

symbols.documentation:
Computes the transposed 2D convolution of an image, also known as a
deconvolution.

parameters.name: input
parameters.documentation:
The input tensor, of rank 4 or rank 3, of shape
`[batch, height, width, inChannels]`. If rank 3, batch of 1 is
assumed.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.documentation:
The filter tensor, rank 4, of shape
`[filterHeight, filterWidth, inChannels, channelMultiplier]`.

parameters.name: strides
parameters.documentation:
The strides of the convolution: `[strideHeight,
strideWidth]`. If strides is a single number, then `strideHeight ==
strideWidth`.

parameters.name: pad
parameters.documentation:
The type of padding algorithm.
- `same` and stride 1: output will be of same size as input,
regardless of filter size.
- `valid`: output will be smaller than input if filter is larger
than 1x1.
- For more info, see this guide:
[https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Convolution](
https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Convolution)

parameters.name: dilations
parameters.documentation:
The dilation rates: `[dilationHeight, dilationWidth]`
in which we sample input values across the height and width dimensions
in atrous convolution. Defaults to `[1, 1]`. If `dilations` is a single
number, then `dilationHeight == dilationWidth`. If it is greater than
1, then all values of `strides` must be 1.

parameters.name: dimRoundingMode
parameters.documentation:
The rounding mode used when computing output
dimensions if pad is a number. If none is provided, it will not round
and error if the output is of fractional size.

symbols.documentation:
Depthwise 2D convolution.

Given a 4D `input` array and a `filter` array of shape
`[filterHeight, filterWidth, inChannels, channelMultiplier]` containing
`inChannels` convolutional filters of depth 1, this op applies a
different filter to each input channel (expanding from 1 channel to
`channelMultiplier` channels for each), then concatenates the results
together. The output has `inChannels * channelMultiplier` channels.

See
[https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/nn/depthwise_conv2d](
     https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/nn/depthwise_conv2d)
for more details.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation:
The input tensor, of rank 4 or rank 3 of shape
`[batch, height, width, inChannels]`. If rank 3, batch of 1 is assumed.

parameters.name: filterSize
parameters.documentation: The filter size, a tuple `[filterHeight, filterWidth]`.

parameters.name: strides
parameters.documentation: The strides of the pooling: `[strideHeight, strideWidth]`.

parameters.name: pad
parameters.documentation:
The type of padding algorithm.
- `same` and stride 1: output will be of same size as input,
regardless of filter size.
- `valid`: output will be smaller than input if filter is larger
than 1x1.
- For more info, see this guide:
[https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Convolution](
https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Convolution)

parameters.name: dimRoundingMode
parameters.documentation:
The rounding mode used when computing output
dimensions if pad is a number. If none is provided, it will not round
and error if the output is of fractional size.

symbols.documentation: Computes the 2D max pooling of an image.

parameters.name: input
parameters.documentation:
The input tensor, of rank 4 or rank 3 of shape
`[batch, height, width, inChannels]`. If rank 3, batch of 1 is assumed.

parameters.name: filterSize
parameters.documentation: The filter size, a tuple `[filterHeight, filterWidth]`.

parameters.name: strides
parameters.documentation: The strides of the pooling: `[strideHeight, strideWidth]`.

parameters.name: pad
parameters.documentation:
The type of padding algorithm.
- `same` and stride 1: output will be of same size as input,
regardless of filter size.
- `valid`: output will be smaller than input if filter is larger
than 1x1.
- For more info, see this guide:
[https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Convolution](
https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/nn#Convolution)

parameters.name: dimRoundingMode
parameters.documentation:
The rounding mode used when computing output
dimensions if pad is a number. If none is provided, it will not round
and error if the output is of fractional size.

symbols.documentation: Computes the 2D min pooling of an image.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
The dimension to reduce. By default it reduces
across all axes and returns the flat index

symbols.documentation:
Returns the indices of the maximum values along an `axis`.

The result has the same shape as `input` with the dimension along `axis`
removed.

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 3]);

x.argMax().print();  // or dl.argMax(x)
```

```js
const x = dl.tensor2d([1, 2, 4, 3], [2, 2]);

const axis = 1;
x.argMax(axis).print();  // or dl.argMax(x, axis)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
The dimension to reduce. By default it reduces
across all axes and returns the flat index.

symbols.documentation:
Returns the indices of the minimum values along an `axis`.

The result has the same shape as `input` with the dimension along `axis`
removed.

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 3]);

x.argMin().print();  // or dl.argMin(x)
```

```js
const x = dl.tensor2d([1, 2, 4, 3], [2, 2]);

const axis = 1;
x.argMin(axis).print();  // or dl.argMin(x, axis)
```

parameters.name: input
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
The dimension(s) to reduce. If null (the default),
reduces all dimensions.

parameters.name: keepDims
parameters.documentation:
If true, retains reduced dimensions with length
of 1. Defaults to false.

symbols.documentation:
Computes the log(sum(exp(elements across the reduction dimensions)).

Reduces the input along the dimensions given in `axis`. Unless `keepDims`
is true, the rank of the array is reduced by 1 for each entry in `axis`.
If `keepDims` is true, the reduced dimensions are retained with length 1.
If `axis` has no entries, all dimensions are reduced, and an array with a
single element is returned.

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 3]);

x.logSumExp().print();  // or dl.logSumExp(x)
```

```js
const x = dl.tensor2d([1, 2, 3, 4], [2, 2]);

const axis = 1;
x.logSumExp(axis).print();  // or dl.logSumExp(a, axis)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
The dimension(s) to reduce. By default it reduces
all dimensions.

parameters.name: keepDims
parameters.documentation: If true, retains reduced dimensions with size 1.

symbols.documentation:
Computes the maximum of elements across dimensions of a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor).

Reduces the input along the dimensions given in `axes`. Unless `keepDims`
is true, the rank of the [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) is reduced by 1 for each entry in `axes`.
If `keepDims` is true, the reduced dimensions are retained with length 1.
If `axes` has no entries, all dimensions are reduced, and an [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) with
a single element is returned.

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 3]);

x.max().print();  // or dl.max(x)
```

```js
const x = dl.tensor2d([1, 2, 3, 4], [2, 2]);

const axis = 1;
x.max(axis).print();  // or dl.max(x, axis)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
The dimension(s) to reduce. By default it reduces
all dimensions.

parameters.name: keepDims
parameters.documentation: If true, retains reduced dimensions with size 1.

symbols.documentation:
Computes the mean of elements across dimensions of a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor).

Reduces `x` along the dimensions given in `axis`. Unless `keepDims` is
true, the rank of the [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) is reduced by 1 for each entry in `axis`.
If `keepDims` is true, the reduced dimensions are retained with length 1.
If `axis` has no entries, all dimensions are reduced, and a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) with
a single element is returned.

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 3]);

x.mean().print();  // or dl.logSumExp(a)
```

```js
const x = dl.tensor2d([1, 2, 3, 4], [2, 2]);

const axis = 1;
x.mean(axis).print();  // or dl.mean(x, axis)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input Tensor.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
The dimension(s) to reduce. By default it reduces
all dimensions.

parameters.name: keepDims
parameters.documentation: If true, retains reduced dimensions with size 1.

symbols.documentation:
Computes the minimum value from the input.

Reduces the input along the dimensions given in `axes`. Unless `keepDims`
is true, the rank of the array is reduced by 1 for each entry in `axes`.
If `keepDims` is true, the reduced dimensions are retained with length 1.
If `axes` has no entries, all dimensions are reduced, and an array with a
single element is returned.

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 3]);

x.min().print();  // or dl.min(x)
```

```js
const x = dl.tensor2d([1, 2, 3, 4], [2, 2]);

const axis = 1;
x.min(axis).print();  // or dl.min(x, axis)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor to compute the sum over.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
The dimension(s) to reduce. By default it reduces
all dimensions.

parameters.name: keepDims
parameters.documentation: If true, retains reduced dimensions with size 1.

symbols.documentation:
Computes the sum of elements across dimensions of a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor).

Reduces the input along the dimensions given in `axes`. Unless `keepDims`
is true, the rank of the [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) is reduced by 1 for each entry in `axes`.
If `keepDims` is true, the reduced dimensions are retained with length 1.
If axes has no entries, all dimensions are reduced, and a [Tensor](#class:dl.Tensor) with a
single element is returned.

```js
const x = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 3]);

x.sum().print();  // or dl.logSumExp(x)
```

```js
const x = dl.tensor2d([1, 2, 3, 4], [2, 2]);

const axis = 1;
x.sum(axis).print();  // or dl.sum(x, axis)
```

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input Tensor.

parameters.name: mean
parameters.documentation: A mean Tensor.

parameters.name: variance
parameters.documentation: A variance Tensor.

parameters.name: varianceEpsilon
parameters.documentation: A small float number to avoid dividing by 0.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.documentation: A scale Tensor.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.documentation: An offset Tensor.

symbols.documentation:
Batch normalization.

As described in
[http://arxiv.org/abs/1502.03167](http://arxiv.org/abs/1502.03167).

Mean, variance, scale, and offset can be of two
shapes:
   - The same shape as the input.
   - In the common case, the depth dimension is the last dimension of x, so
     the values would be an [Tensor1D](#class:dl.Tensor) of shape [depth].

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation:
The input tensor. The 4-D input tensor is treated as a 3-D array
of 1D vectors (along the last dimension), and each vector is
normalized independently.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.documentation:
The number of adjacent channels or spatial locations of the
1D normalization window. In Tensorflow this param is called
'depth_radius' because only 'acrossChannels' mode is supported.

parameters.name: bias
parameters.documentation: A constant bias term for the basis.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.documentation: A scale factor, usually positive.

parameters.name: beta
parameters.documentation: An exponent.

parameters.name: normRegion
parameters.documentation: Default is 'acrossChannels'.

symbols.documentation:
Normalizes the activation of a local neighborhood across or within
channels.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.documentation:
The dimension(s) along with to compute mean and
variance. By default it reduces all dimensions.

parameters.name: keepDims
parameters.documentation:
If true, the moments have the same dimensionality as the
input.

symbols.documentation:
Calculates the mean and variance of `x`. The mean and variance are
calculated by aggregating the contents of `x` across `axes`. If `x` is
1-D and `axes = [0]` this is just the mean and variance of a vector.

parameters.name: logits
parameters.documentation: The logits array.

parameters.name: dim
parameters.documentation:
The dimension softmax would be performed on. Defaults to `-1`
which indicates the last dimension.

symbols.documentation:
Computes the softmax normalized vector given the logits.

```js
const a = dl.tensor1d([1, 2, 3]);

a.softmax().print();  // or dl.softmax(a)
```

```js
const a = dl.tensor2d([2, 4, 6, 1, 2, 3], [2, 3]);

a.softmax().print();  // or dl.softmax(a)
```

parameters.name: images
parameters.documentation:
The images, of rank 4 or rank 3, of shape
`[batch, height, width, inChannels]`. If rank 3, batch of 1 is assumed.

parameters.name: size
parameters.documentation:
The new shape `[newHeight, newWidth]` to resize the
images to. Each channel is resized individually.

parameters.name: alignCorners
parameters.documentation:
Defaults to False. If true, rescale
input by `(new_height - 1) / (height - 1)`, which exactly aligns the 4
corners of images and resized images. If false, rescale by
`new_height / height`. Treat similarly the width dimension.

symbols.documentation: Bilinear resize a batch of 3D images to a new shape.

parameters.name: forgetBias
parameters.documentation: Forget bias for the cell.

parameters.name: lstmKernel
parameters.documentation: The weights for the cell.

parameters.name: lstmBias
parameters.documentation: The bias for the cell.

parameters.name: data
parameters.documentation: The input to the cell.

parameters.name: c
parameters.documentation: Previous cell state.

parameters.name: h
parameters.documentation: Previous cell output.

symbols.documentation:
Computes the next state and output of a BasicLSTMCell.

Returns `[newC, newH]`.

Derived from tf.contrib.rnn.BasicLSTMCell.

parameters.name: lstmCells
parameters.documentation: Array of LSTMCell functions.

parameters.name: data
parameters.documentation: The input to the cell.

parameters.name: c
parameters.documentation: Array of previous cell states.

parameters.name: h
parameters.documentation: Array of previous cell outputs.

symbols.documentation:
Computes the next states and outputs of a stack of LSTMCells.

Each cell output is used as input to the next cell.

Returns `[cellState, cellOutput]`.

Derived from tf.contrib.rn.MultiRNNCell.

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first input tensor.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: The second input tensor. Must have the same dtype as `a`.

symbols.documentation:
Returns the truth value of (a == b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

We also expose `equalStrict` which has the same signature as this op
and asserts that `a` and `b` are the same shape (does not broadcast).

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first input tensor.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: The second input tensor. Must have the same dtype as `a`.

symbols.documentation:
Returns the truth value of (a > b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

We also expose `greaterStrict` which has the same signature as this
op and asserts that `a` and `b` are the same shape (does not broadcast).

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first input tensor.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: The second input tensor. Must have the same dtype as `a`.

symbols.documentation:
Returns the truth value of (a >= b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

We also expose `greaterStrict` which has the same signature as this
op and asserts that `a` and `b` are the same shape (does not broadcast).

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first input tensor.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: The second input tensor. Must have the same dtype as `a`.

symbols.documentation:
Returns the truth value of (a < b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

We also expose `lessStrict` which has the same signature as this op and
asserts that `a` and `b` are the same shape (does not broadcast).

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first input tensor.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: The second input tensor. Must have the same dtype as `a`.

symbols.documentation:
Returns the truth value of (a <= b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

We also expose `lessEqualStrict` which has the same signature as this op
and asserts that `a` and `b` are the same shape (does not broadcast).

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first input tensor. Must be of dtype bool.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: The second input tensor. Must be of dtype bool.

symbols.documentation: Returns the truth value of a AND b element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

parameters.name: x
parameters.documentation: The input tensor. Must be of dtype 'bool'.

symbols.documentation: Returns the truth value of `NOT x` element-wise.

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first input tensor. Must be of dtype bool.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: The second input tensor. Must be of dtype bool.

symbols.documentation: Returns the truth value of `a OR b` element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first input tensor. Must be of dtype bool.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: The second input tensor. Must be of dtype bool.

symbols.documentation: Returns the truth value of `a XOR b` element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation: The first input tensor.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: The second input tensor. Must have the same dtype as `a`.

symbols.documentation:
Returns the truth value of (a != b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

We also expose `notEqualStrict` which has the same signature as this op and
asserts that `a` and `b` are the same shape (does not broadcast).

parameters.name: condition
parameters.documentation: The input condition. Must be of dtype bool.

parameters.name: a
parameters.documentation:
If `condition` is rank 1, `a` may have a higher rank but
its first dimension must match the size of `condition`.

parameters.name: b
parameters.documentation: A tensor with the same shape and type as `a`.

symbols.documentation:
Returns the elements, either `a` or `b` depending on the `condition`.

If the condition is true, select from `a`, otherwise select from `b`.

headings.name: Training
headings.description:
We also provide an API to do perform training, and compute gradients. We compute gradients eagerly, users provide a function that is a combination of operations and we automatically differentiate that function's output with respect to its inputs.

For those familiar with TensorFlow, the API we expose exactly mirrors the TensorFlow Eager API.

parameters.name: f
parameters.documentation: The function f(x), to compute gradient for.

parameters.name: f
parameters.documentation: The function `f(x1, x2,...)` to compute gradients for.

parameters.name: f
parameters.documentation:
The function to evaluate in forward mode, which should return
`{value: Tensor, gradFunc: (dy) => Tensor[]}`, where `gradFunc` returns
the custom gradients of `f` with respect to its inputs.

parameters.name: f
parameters.documentation: The function to execute. f() should return a scalar.

parameters.name: varList
parameters.documentation: The list of trainable variables. Defaults to all variables.

parameters.name: learningRate
parameters.documentation: The learning rate to use for the SGD algorithm.

parameters.name: learningRate
parameters.documentation:
The learning rate to use for the Momentum gradient
descent algorithm.

parameters.name: momentum
parameters.documentation:
The momentum to use for the momentum gradient descent
algorithm.

symbols.documentation:
Constructs a [MomentumOptimizer](#class:dl.train.Optimizer) that uses momentum gradient
descent.

See
[http://proceedings.mlr.press/v28/sutskever13.pdf](
http://proceedings.mlr.press/v28/sutskever13.pdf)

parameters.name: learningRate
parameters.documentation:
The learning rate to use for the Adagrad gradient
descent algorithm.

parameters.name: initialAccumulatorValue
parameters.documentation:
Starting value for the accumulators, must be
positive.

symbols.documentation:
Constructs a [AdagradOptimizer](#class:dl.train.Optimizer) that uses the Adagrad algorithm.
See
[http://www.jmlr.org/papers/volume12/duchi11a/duchi11a.pdf](
http://www.jmlr.org/papers/volume12/duchi11a/duchi11a.pdf)
or
[http://ruder.io/optimizing-gradient-descent/index.html#adagrad](
http://ruder.io/optimizing-gradient-descent/index.html#adagrad)

parameters.name: learningRate
parameters.documentation:
The learning rate to use for the Adadelta gradient
descent algorithm.

parameters.name: rho
parameters.documentation: The learning rate decay over each update.

parameters.name: epsilon
parameters.documentation:
A constant epsilon used to better condition the grad
update.

symbols.documentation:
Constructs a [AdadeltaOptimizer](#class:dl.train.Optimizer) that uses the Adadelta algorithm.
See [https://arxiv.org/abs/1212.5701](https://arxiv.org/abs/1212.5701)

parameters.name: learningRate
parameters.documentation:
The learning rate to use for the Adam gradient
descent algorithm.

parameters.name: beta1
parameters.documentation: The exponential decay rate for the 1st moment estimates.

parameters.name: beta2
parameters.documentation: The exponential decay rate for the 2nd moment estimates.

parameters.name: epsilon
parameters.documentation: A small constant for numerical stability.

symbols.documentation:
Constructs a `AdamOptimizer` that uses the Adam algorithm.
See [https://arxiv.org/abs/1412.6980](https://arxiv.org/abs/1412.6980)

parameters.name: learningRate
parameters.documentation:
The learning rate to use for the Adamax gradient
descent algorithm.

parameters.name: beta1
parameters.documentation: The exponential decay rate for the 1st moment estimates.

parameters.name: beta2
parameters.documentation: The exponential decay rate for the 2nd moment estimates.

parameters.name: epsilon
parameters.documentation: A small constant for numerical stability.

parameters.name: decay
parameters.documentation: The learning rate decay over each update.

symbols.documentation:
Constructs a `AdamaxOptimizer` that uses the Adamax algorithm.
See [https://arxiv.org/abs/1412.6980](https://arxiv.org/abs/1412.6980)

parameters.name: learningRate
parameters.documentation:
The learning rate to use for the RMSProp gradient
descent algorithm.

parameters.name: decay
parameters.documentation: The discounting factor for the history/coming gradient.

parameters.name: momentum
parameters.documentation:
The momentum to use for the RMSProp gradient descent
algorithm.

parameters.name: epsilon
parameters.documentation: Small value to avoid zero denominator.

symbols.documentation:
Constructs a [RMSPropOptimizer](#class:dl.train.Optimizer) that uses RMSProp gradient
descent. This implementation uses plain momentum and is not centered
version of RMSProp.

See
[http://www.cs.toronto.edu/~tijmen/csc321/slides/lecture_slides_lec6.pdf](
http://www.cs.toronto.edu/~tijmen/csc321/slides/lecture_slides_lec6.pdf)

parameters.name: labels
parameters.documentation: The labels array.

parameters.name: logits
parameters.documentation: The logits array.

parameters.name: dim
parameters.documentation:
The dimension softmax would be performed on. Defaults to `-1`
which indicates the last dimension.

symbols.documentation:
Computes softmax cross entropy between logits and labels.

Measures the probability error in discrete classification tasks in which
the classes are mutually exclusive (each entry is in exactly one class).
For example, each CIFAR-10 image is labeled with one and only one label: an
image can be a dog or a truck, but not both.

`NOTE`: While the classes are mutually exclusive, their probabilities need
not be. All that is required is that each row of labels is a valid
probability distribution. If they are not, the computation of the gradient
will be incorrect.

`WARNING`: This op expects unscaled logits, since it performs a softmax on
logits internally for efficiency. Do not call this op with the output of
softmax, as it will produce incorrect results.

logits and labels must have the same shape, e.g. [batch_size, num_classes]
and the same dtype.

parameters.name: f
parameters.documentation: The function to execute and whose output to minimize.

parameters.name: returnCost
parameters.documentation:
Whether to return the scalar cost value produced by
executing `f()`.

parameters.name: varList
parameters.documentation:
An optional list of variables to update. If specified, only
the trainable variables in varList will be updated by minimize. Defaults to
all trainable variables.

methods.documentation:
Executes `f()` and minimizes the scalar output of `f()` by computing
gradients of y with respect to the list of trainable variables provided by
`varList`. If no list is provided, it defaults to all trainable variables.

parameters.name: nameOrFn
parameters.documentation:
The name of the closure, or the function to execute.
If a name is provided, the 2nd argument should be the function.
If debug mode is on, the timing and the memory usage of the function
will be tracked and displayed on the console using the provided name.

parameters.name: fn
parameters.documentation: The function to execute.

parameters.name: gradMode
parameters.documentation: If true, starts a tape and doesn't dispose tensors.

parameters.name: result
parameters.documentation: The tensor to keep from being disposed.

symbols.documentation:
Returns memory info at the current time in the program. The result is an
object with the following properties:

- `numBytes`: Number of bytes allocated (undisposed) at this time.
- `numTensors`: Number of unique tensors allocated.
- `numDataBuffers`: Number of unique data buffers allocated
   (undisposed) at this time, which is  the number of tensors
   (e.g. `a.reshape(newShape)` makes a new Tensor that shares the same
   data buffer with `a`).
- `unreliable`: `Optional` `boolean`:
    - On WebGL, not present (always reliable).
    - On CPU, true. Due to automatic garbage collection, these numbers
     represent undisposed tensors, i.e. not wrapped in `dl.tidy()`, or
     lacking a call to `tensor.dispose()`.

parameters.name: f
parameters.documentation: The function to execute and time.

symbols.documentation:
Executes `f()` and returns a promise that resolves with timing information.

The result is an object with the following properties:

- `wallMs`: Wall execution time.
- `kernelMs`: Kernel execution time, ignoring data transfer.
- On `WebGL` The following additional properties exist:
   - `uploadWaitMs`: CPU blocking time on texture uploads.
   - `downloadWaitMs`: CPU blocking time on texture downloads (readPixels).

```js
const x = dl.randomNormal([20, 20]);
const time = await dl.time(() => x.matMul(x));

console.log(`kernelMs: ${time.kernelMs}, wallTimeMs: ${time.wallMs}`);
```

Returns a promise that resolve when a requestAnimationFrame has completed.

This is simply a sugar method so that users can do the following:
`await dl.nextFrame();`

headings.name: Environment
headings.description: deeplearn.js can run mathematical operations on different backends. Currently, we support WebGL and JavaScript CPU. By default, we choose the 'best' backend available, but allow users to customize their backend.

parameters.name: backendType
parameters.documentation: The backend type. Currently supports `'webgl'|'cpu'`.

parameters.name: safeMode
parameters.documentation:
Defaults to false. In safe mode, you are forced to
construct tensors and call math operations inside a `dl.tidy()` which
will automatically clean up intermediate tensors.

symbols.documentation:
Sets the backend (cpu, webgl, etc) responsible for creating tensors and
executing operations on those tensors.

Returns the current backend (cpu, webgl, etc). The backend is responsible
for creating tensors and executing operations on those tensors.
